definitions: To avoid doing something that you should do or that you have promised to do.
To leave a place or situation.
To obtain something from someone or something, often with difficulty.
To stop having a particular habit or doing a particular activity.
examples: He tried to get out of doing his chores.
I need to get out of this meeting early.
Can you get any information out of him?
She's trying to get out of smoking.
pastTenses: got out of, gotten out of
